benchmark_details.name: OmniBench
benchmark_details.overview: OmniBench is a novel benchmark designed to evaluate models' ability to recognize, interpret, and reason across visual, acoustic, and textual inputs simultaneously, categorized under omni-language models (OLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of OmniBench is to rigorously evaluate multimodal large language models' capabilities to integrate and understand visual, acoustic, and textual information.

data.source: The dataset is created from various tasks categorized under causal inference, identification, and abstract concepts, requiring integrated understanding across modalities.
data.annotation: Annotated through a rigorous protocol involving initial annotation, human inspection, and model inspection to ensure high-quality multimodal-dependent samples.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the ratio matched between the correct option and model response.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy is interpreted as the percentage of correct responses out of total attempts.
methodology.baseline_results: Human evaluators achieved an accuracy of 63.19% which serves as a benchmark for model comparison.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures include rigorous human inspections and automated quality checks.
